paragraph.paragraph:
The Component viewer allows you to view the structure of a
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlcomponent component without having to create new
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject objects from the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlcomponent component .

This tool is displayed in a separate window, and may either be shown or hidden (default). To change between these two states, click
/images/eiffelbuild/icons/icon_component_viewer_color.png on the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/10_general_interface_description/20_main_toolbars.xml main toolbar , or select Show/Hide component viewer from the View menu.
paragraph.heading: 2Targeting a component
paragraph.paragraph:
To target a
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlcomponent component into the tool,
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop pick the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlcomponent component from the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/65_component_viewer/index.xml component_viewer , and
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop drop on the
/images/eiffelbuild/icons/icon_component_viewer_color.png displayed in the tool bar of the component viewer (See screenshots above). Any existing component displayed is simply removed.

Alternatively, you can hold down the Ctrl key while starting a
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop pick on a
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlcomponent component in the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/63_component_selector/index.xml component_selector . This will automatically target the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlcomponent component to the component viewer. If the viewer is currently hidden, it will also make it visible.
paragraph.heading: 2View types
paragraph.paragraph:
Looking at the left-hand screenshot above, you can see that the
/images/eiffelbuild/icons/icon_component_display_view_color.png button is depressed, meaning the component viewer is in display view mode. Clicking on
/images/eiffelbuild/icons/icon_component_build_view_color.png will put the component viewer into build mode view as shown in the right-hand screenshot. These modes are mutually exclusive and are described below:

list.item:
Builder view - This view is similar to the view used by the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/50_layout_window/index.xml display window . i.e. the
/libraries/vision2/00_introduction.xml EiffelVision2 controls are displayed exactly as is defined in the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlcomponent component .

Display view - This view is similar to the view used by the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/60_builder_window/index.xml builder window . i.e. all
/libraries/vision2/00_introduction.xml EiffelVision2 containers are represented by frames so they are immediately visible. This makes the actual structure represented by the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlcomponent component completely visible.

paragraph.note: Note: The type of the "root_object" within the component is displayed in the toolbar of the component viewer.
